intro: Octomeria lancipetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved octomeria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
